name: com.muxy.gamelink
description:
Muxy GameLink is the easy solution to add Twitch viewer interactivity to your game and generate revenue through Twitch Bits.

Muxy’s GameLink provides the necessary tools for game developers to create audience-interactive mechanics in their games. When Twitch streamers have a Muxy GameLink extension active, viewers can directly interact with your game as it’s played. 

‚úîÔ∏è Our entire solution involves: 

  • GameLink to connect the Twitch audience to your game functionality
  • MEDKit to easily create Twitch Extension including starter templates
  • Muxy’s Cloud Services to handle Twitch-scale traffic load, ensuring your viewer interactivity can handle the spikey nature of Twitch traffic patterns in excess of 1,000,000 viewers. 

How to Design For Audience Interactivity

Twitch broadcasters want to engage with their community in meaningful ways. Muxy allows game developers to add an interactive layer that viewers can utilize to help, hinder, or otherwise disrupt a streamer’s play session. This creates fun moments that call out the very viewer causing the disruption. Muxy also allows information to pass from the broadcaster’s game client to a Twitch Extension, so viewers can see information about the streamer’s in-game character or game progression.

Visit Muxy for more information and development documentation

üòà Hinder examples:

  • Viewers can spawn an enemy with their name on it in your game and battle their favorite broadcaster by using 500 Twitch Bits. 
  • Viewers use Twitch bits to set a limit on the amount of ammo a broadcaster has for their favorite weapon.
  • Viewers can also take turns choosing debuffs for the broadcaster’s character in a strategy game.

üòá Helpful examples:

  • A viewer can provide a health, ammo, shield, or damage boost to their favorite broadcaster.
  • The community can pool Bits donations to hit a goal that provides an extra life to the broadcaster.

üíÑ Cosmetic examples:

  • Viewers can use Twitch Bits to provide a new player skin or place a Twitch emote onto the streamer’s character in-game.
  • A viewer can use Twitch Bits for naming rights to a character in the streamer’s in-game party to have their Twitch name shown in-game.
  • A viewer could trigger a firework particle effect in-game. 

üó∫Ô∏è Informational examples:

  • Viewers can access what quest the streamer is currently trying to complete and see the information about it.
  • A viewer can see the current attributes, stats, or load-out configuration the streamer has chosen to use.

Pricing

Twitch full information is available here: https://dev.twitch.tv/docs/extensions/monetization

Muxy pricing available here: There is a free tier and live production tier http://muxy.io/pricing

Twitch Bits Revenue explainer

A simplified breakdown of the live process is: When viewers perform an action that requires Bits within the Extension you develop, the streamer earns 80% of 1 U.S. cent per Bit used, with the remaining 20% is shared between the Extension developer (you), and Muxy. The Bits in Extensions program, including revenue share, may be adjusted from time to time or deprecated by Twitch in its sole discretion. Muxy’s revenue share may be adjusted from time to time in accordance with the Muxy Developer Licensing Agreement.
